questionTitle: How many types of protocols are important for instant messaging?
questionExplanation: In an effort to create an interoperability standard between different IM clients, several instant messaging protocols have been created.

questionOption1: Every third-party IM clients aim to allow their users to connect to the different major IM services
questionOption2: SIP stands for Secure Initiation Protocol
questionOption3: XMPP stands for Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol
questionExplanation: SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol.

questionTitle: Which of the following protocol is adopted for interoperability by top three IM service providers?
questionExplanation: They allow their users to connect with the other servicesâ€™ public users for a fee.

questionTitle: Which of the following protocol is not an Internet Engineering Task Force standard?
questionExplanation: IMPS is an IM communications standard.

questionOption1: All IM clients use peer-to-peer messaging
questionOption2: IM software aimed at businesses such as XMPP, Lotus Sametime, and Microsoft Office Communicator use a client/server architecture
questionOption3: Instant messaging is as popular in business as it is in personal communications
questionExplanation: Some IM clients use peer-to-peer messaging.

questionTitle: Which of the following IM client allow their users to connect to the different major IM services?
questionExplanation: Trillian runs on Windows, Macintosh, IOS (iPhone OS), Android, Blackberry, and inside browsers.

questionTitle: Which of the following is also referred to as Short Message Service?
questionExplanation: When a service collects your messages in a conversation, it is called a micro-blog.

questionTitle: Which of the following is a good example of an SMS service organized into a social network and blog?
questionExplanation: It is sometimes referred to as the SMS of the Internet or as a form of Internet Relay Chat (IRC).

questionTitle: Which of the following language is used to build a message server queue in twitter?
questionExplanation: The Twitter Web client was built using Ruby on Rails and deployed on the Ruby Enterprise Edition, with the message queue server written in Scala.

questionTitle: Which of the following version of office suite is shown in the figure?
questionExplanation: Glide Digital OS4 is a complete suite with office software, e-mail, and other tools that replicate an online desktop.
